Detailed Description

Higgs scalar field equation, using multipole expansion.

Assumed spacetime: Kerr-Newman. Coordinates , , , (Boyer-Lindquist). Scalar field: .

Lagrange form (with 1,-1,-1,-1 metric sign convention): . Here and . Field equation: . Here . In the representation, the mass of the perturbation field is (in case of real ): . .

, , where and .

.

The actually evolved field is in the according transformed field equation. The used spatial coordinate is r, except when . In that case the radial coordinate is: with , and with the according transformed field equation. Also logarithmic radial coordinates can be used: in Minkowski case, and otherwise.

Version:
05/01/2007
Since:
GridRipper 0.5, 05/01/2007
Author:
Andras Laszlo
